channel.title: NPR Topics: Technology
channel.description: Latest technology news and breakthroughs in technology, science, and industry. Download the NPR Technology podcast and Technology RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: TV antennas and Super Bowl rehearsals: How prediction market traders seek an edge
item.description: As prediction markets boom, competition is heating up. So traders go the extra mile for a fraction-of-a-second advantage or to sleuth out information nobody else has. It can lead to a huge payday.
item.content:encoded:
As prediction markets boom, competition is heating up. So traders go the extra mile for a fraction-of-a-second advantage or to sleuth out information nobody else has. It can lead to a huge payday.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: As US focuses on perfecting AI models, China wants to become better AI adopters
item.description: The Chinese AI company DeepSeek shocked markets last year with a high-quality, low-cost model. It's now become clearer that China and the U.S. are running two different AI races.
item.content:encoded: The Chinese AI company DeepSeek shocked markets last year with a high-quality, low-cost model. It's now become clearer that China and the U.S. are running two different AI races.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: Landmark tech trials on social media addiction seen through a mother's eyes
item.description: With multiple tech addiction trials expected this year, Julianna Arnold of the parents group 'Parents Rise' says the legal pressure is overdue for Big Tech.
item.content:encoded: With multiple tech addiction trials expected this year, Julianna Arnold of the parents group 'Parents Rise' says the legal pressure is overdue for Big Tech.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Robbins

item.title: ChatGPT promised to help her find her soulmate. Then it betrayed her
item.description: ChatGPT sent screenwriter Micky Small down a fantastical rabbit hole. Now, she's finding her way out.
item.content:encoded:
ChatGPT sent screenwriter Micky Small down a fantastical rabbit hole. Now, she's finding her way out.

(Image credit: Courtney Theophin)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Israel accuses two of using military secrets to place Polymarket bets
item.description: The Tel Aviv indictment is the first publicly known instance of people being accused of leveraging military secrets to place bets on the popular prediction market.
item.content:encoded: The Tel Aviv indictment is the first publicly known instance of people being accused of leveraging military secrets to place bets on the popular prediction market.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: AI brings Supreme Court decisions to life
item.description: Like it or not, the justices are about to see AI versions of themselves, speaking words that they spoke in court but that were not heard contemporaneously by anyone except those in the courtroom.
item.content:encoded:
Like it or not, the justices are about to see AI versions of themselves, speaking words that they spoke in court but that were not heard contemporaneously by anyone except those in the courtroom.

(Image credit: On The Docket)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: 'E-bike for your feet': How bionic sneakers could change human mobility
item.description: Nike's battery-powered footwear system, which propels wearers forward, is part of a broader push to help humans move farther and faster.
item.content:encoded:
Nike's battery-powered footwear system, which propels wearers forward, is part of a broader push to help humans move farther and faster.

(Image credit: Gritchelle Fallesgon for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: A supercomputer beat a human chess champ 30 years ago, paving a path for AI dominance
item.description: In 1996, IBM's Deep Blue faced off against Garry Kasparov, the greatest chess mind on Earth — and changed history.
item.content:encoded:
In 1996, IBM's Deep Blue faced off against Garry Kasparov, the greatest chess mind on Earth — and changed history.

(Image credit: Tom Mihalek)
item.dc:creator: Julian Ring

item.title: A new social media platform creates buzz – but it's just for AI bots
item.description: A new social media platform launched last week and it's got Silicon Valley buzzing, but it's not for humans. Moltbook is a platform for AI agents to talk to other AI agents.
item.content:encoded: A new social media platform launched last week and it's got Silicon Valley buzzing, but it's not for humans. Moltbook is a platform for AI agents to talk to other AI agents.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: State Department will delete X posts from before Trump returned to office
item.description: The policy change orders the removal of any post made by official State Department accounts on X before President Trump returned to office in 2025.
item.content:encoded:
The policy change orders the removal of any post made by official State Department accounts on X before President Trump returned to office in 2025.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond
